html:
LOS ANGELES (AP) — A stolen Amazon delivery truck barrelled into a building in South Los Angeles on Thursday, killing a street vendor and injuring two other people, police said.

The truck apparently was stolen during a delivery at around 2 p.m. and driven away before crashing into a parked car about a half-mile away and ending up on a sidewalk, police said.

The street vendor died when he was pinned between the truck and the building and died at the scene while two other people standing nearby received minor injuries, police told KTLA-TV.

The driver fled but a witness followed him and called 911, leading to an arrest, police said.
